item.title: By: Smackademic, PhD. Depl. Stud.
item.dc:creator: Smackademic, PhD. Depl. Stud.
item.description:
Fallacious argument. You could apply the same false argument to military spending in general: Almost zero deaths from Russians or Communist China during Cold War means we should ever have spent money on the Military. Even the Japanese only killed 2400, why spend money and declare war when more Americans died from car accidents in that same year?
You never ask the question about how much death, injury, economic instability, etc. is prevented through investments in counter-terrorism. Instead you snobbishly discount the whole affair as the result of stupid humans overreacting, while idiotically overlooking the obvious reason.
You, like all weak minded conspiratorial leftists fail to understand the threat? How much damage would have been done if a 2004 dirty bomb plot was not foiled at the NYC stock exchange? What would have been the damage in human lives and economic impact of the foiled plot to blow up a natural gas refinery in 2005? These are just a couple of the scores of potentially world changing attacks that have been prevented.
Maybe you should stop trying to think by numbers and start thinking with reason instead, fool.
Reading through all the comments it's sad how many fell for your rhetoric. Pathetic sheep one and all.
